paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Demo:** Hive Skewed Table
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive mechanisms to mitigate skew
**File locations:** labs/data/
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive skewed tables
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Data Engineering with Hive 

---

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the files from S3
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cd tmp
wget --quiet -O Rev6.zip https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/sci-241/HortonworksUniversity-DevPH_Labs-archive/Rev6.zip
unzip -p Rev6.zip DevPH_Labs-Rev6/labs/Lab3.1/salaries.txt > salaries.txt
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p data/salaries
hdfs dfs -put -f salaries.txt data/salaries
rm Rev6.zip

paragraphs.title: Create a skewed table
Populate the skewed table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

insert overwrite table skew_demo select gender,age,salary,zip from salarydata;

paragraphs.title: Question
paragraphs.text:
%md

Which values are skewing this table?

paragraphs.title: Additional resources
paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Tutorials](http://cloudera.com/tutorials.html) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community](https://community.cloudera.com) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Apache Spark Documentation](https://spark.apache.org/documentation.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page](https://zeppelin.apache.org) - official Zeppelin web site.
